excerpt: This long, historic city wall with scenic views is a popular place for walking & bicycling.
detail_description: Xian's Ancient City Wall is a well-preserved historic site that offers scenic views and is popular for walking and bicycling. The city of Xian, though not one of China's largest, is a top tourist destination due to its rich historical monuments and ancient sites such as the Terracotta Warriors, Giant Wild Goose Pagoda, and the Ancient City Wall. Visitors can also explore the Shaanxi History Museum to delve into Chinese history.
name: Ancient City Wall
address: China, Shaanxi, Xi'An, Beilin, 陕西

excerpt: Large history museum displaying fossils, murals, pottery & metal objects in a Tang-style building.
detail_description: Shaanxi History Museum, located near the Giant Wild Goose Pagoda, is a large museum housed in a traditional Tang-style building. It boasts over 370,000 cultural relics dating back over 1 million years to the late Qing dynasty. The museum holds various exhibitions and also features Chinese and foreign classic paintings, calligraphy works, children's paintings, photography, sculpture works, film and television media art.
name: Shaanxi History Museum
address: 91 Xiaozhai E Rd, Yanta District, Xi'An, Shaanxi, China, 710064

excerpt: Dating to the 7th century, this towering Buddhist pagoda was built to house sacred scriptures.
detail_description: The Giant Wild Goose Pagoda, also known as Big Wild Goose Pagoda, is a renowned attraction in Xi'an, China. Dating back to the 7th century during the Tang Dynasty, this brick pagoda was initially constructed with five stories to house Buddhist scriptures and figurines brought from India. Renovated during the Ming Dynasty, it now stands at a height of 64 meters and serves as a well-preserved religious site for Buddhists.
name: Giant Wild Goose Pagoda
address: 1 Cien Rd, Yanta District, Xi'An, Shaanxi, China, 710064

excerpt: Iconic bell tower built in 1384 during the Ming dynasty with historic displays & city vistas.
detail_description: The Bell Tower of Xi'an, built in 1384 during the Ming dynasty, is a historic landmark that has stood for over 600 years. Originally used to announce the time, it now serves as a museum showcasing cultural relics and traditional artworks. Visitors can enjoy daytime performances and admire stunning scenery at night. Situated at the geographical center of ancient Xian, this iconic wooden tower stands 36m tall on a nearly 9m high brick base.
name: Bell Tower of Xi'an
address: 7W5W+QRJ, Bei Lin Qu, Xi'An, Shaanxi, China, 710007

detail_description: The Drum Tower in Xi'an, China is a significant landmark that serves as the gateway to the Muslim Quarter. It is located in the Northwest quadrant of the ancient walled city and offers a glimpse into the area's rich history dating back to the 7th Century AD. The nearby Bell Tower acts as a central landmark from which prosperous commercial streets extend in all directions.
name: Drum Tower
address: 6WQR+2QV, Jianfusi Rd, Beilin, Xi'An, Shaanxi, China, 710064

excerpt: Opulent mosque built in 742 & featuring colorful architecture & placid gardens.
detail_description: The Great Mosque of Xi'an is a stunning architectural marvel built in 742, boasting vibrant and colorful designs along with serene gardens. The mosque stands as a symbol of the harmonious coexistence between Muslim and Han people in Xian. Surrounding the mosque, visitors can explore streets lined with various crafts and traditional Shaanxi handicrafts. Nearby, the Muslim Quarter offers an array of delectable Muslim cuisine, including roasted beef, fish, and pancakes at reasonable prices.
name: Great Mosque of Xi'an
address: 7W7Q+7JF, Huajue Ln, Lianhu District, Xi'An, Shaanxi, China, 710001

excerpt: Museum of objects from the Banpo archaeological dig, which uncovered a 6,000-year-old civilization.
detail_description: Banpo Museum is a fascinating destination that showcases objects from the Banpo archaeological site, revealing a 6,000-year-old civilization. Situated on the relics of Neolithic Yangshao culture, it offers an enriching experience for history enthusiasts. Visitors can easily access this museum by driving eastward for Lintong or taking City Bus U5 (306) from the railway station's east square.
name: Banpo
address: 155 Banpo Rd, Baqiao District, Xi'An, Shaanxi, China, 710024

detail_description: The Bell Tower Commercial Area is the city's largest shopping district, offering a variety of big department stores and supermarkets. Nearby, visitors can explore the famous Muslim Street for souvenirs, food, and handicrafts. The area also features upscale malls like Kai Yuan Shopping Mall and Century Ginwa Shopping Mall. Additionally, the Bell Tower serves as an entrance to the Big Wild Goose Pagoda tourist area where visitors can admire its historical construction that is well preserved and maintained.
name: Bell Tower
address: China, Shaanxi, Xi'An, Yanta District, Cien Rd, 慈恩路大慈恩寺内, 邮政编码: 710063

detail_description: The Museum of Qin Terracotta Warriors and Horses West Gate is a significant part of the Emperor Qinshihuangs Mausoleum Site Museum, which includes the Qin Shihuang Mausoleum Relics Park and Lishan Garden. This museum showcases the world-renowned Terracotta Army, a UNESCO World Heritage site and one of China's national AAAAA level tourist attractions. The burial pit covers an extensive area of 2.
name: Museum of Qin Terracotta Warriors and Horses West Gate
address: 97MG+G67, Wangjian Rd, Lintong District, Xi'An, Shaanxi, China, 710611

excerpt: Landmark pagoda dating to 8th century offering scenic views from the top & an adjacent park.
detail_description: Small Wild Goose Pagoda is a must-see landmark in Xi'an, China. Dating back to the 8th century, it offers stunning views from the top and is surrounded by an adjacent park. The pagoda is part of the historical Jianfu Temple complex, which has been rebuilt during the Ming and Qing dynasties.
name: Small Wild Goose Pagoda
address: 72 Youyi W Rd, Beilin, Xi'An, Shaanxi, China, 710064

detail_description: The Tang Dynasty, established in 1988, is a cultural treasure of Xi'an that attracts both locals and visitors. It stands out as the first establishment to showcase dance and music performances in the ancient Tang Dynasty style. This venue offers a unique experience with nightly dinner theater where guests can enjoy both food and performances, reminiscent of imperial palace luxury.
name: Tang Dynasty
address: 75 Chang'an N Rd, Beilin, Xi'An, Shaanxi, China, 710064

detail_description: Huaqing Palace, also referred to as Huaqing Hot Springs, is a renowned historical site that has served as an imperial palace for over 3000 years. Situated at the foot of Mount Li, it was initially built by Emperor Zhouyouwang of the Western Zhou Dynasty and later used by emperors from various dynasties including Qin, Han, Sui, and Tang for winter retreats.
name: Huaqing Palace
address: Lin Tong Qu, Xi An Shi, China, 710699

detail_description: Century Ginwa is a prestigious shopping center situated between the historic Bell Tower and Drum Tower in Xi'an. Since its establishment in 1998, it has become a hub for over sixty renowned global brands such as Bally, Burberry, Dior, Givenchy, Lancome, and Estee Lauder. The mall caters to discerning customers seeking high-quality products.
name: Century Ginwa
address: Wei Yang Qu, Xi An Shi, China, 710018

detail_description: Xingqinggong Park in Xian is a beautiful and well-maintained park that offers various activities for visitors. You can join in aerobics, singing, and dancing or take a leisurely walk around the lake. The park also features a small amusement park that is perfect for families with kids. During spring and summer, the park blooms with colorful flowers, making it an ideal time to visit.
name: Xingqinggong Park
address: 55 Xianning W Rd, Beilin, Xi'An, Shaanxi, China, 710048

detail_description: Kaiyuan Shopping Mall, situated at the southeastern corner of the Bell Tower in Xi'an, is a prominent department store offering an extensive range of over 130,000 products. It boasts a high-quality shopping environment and exceptional service for all visitors. As one of the largest shopping centers in Xi'an, it provides reasonable prices and caters to diverse shopping needs. Additionally, its central location makes it easily accessible for locals and tourists alike.
name: Kaiyuan Shopping Mall
address: 6 Jiefang Mkt, 钟楼商圈 Beilin, Xi'An, Shaanxi, China, 710004

detail_description: Cuihua Mountain is a natural wonder in Xian, China, offering a serene escape from the city's fast pace. In addition to famous landmarks like the Bell and Drum Towers and the ancient city wall, Xian boasts this awe-inspiring mountain. Visitors can easily navigate the city using public transportation such as the metro, bus, train, and taxi. Special tourist bus lines and sightseeing hop-on-hop-off buses make exploring convenient.
name: Cuihua Mountain
address: Chang'An, Xi'An, China, 710105

detail_description: Antique Market, also known as the Ancient Cultural Street of Shuyuanmen, is a must-visit destination for souvenir shopping. Here you can find unique items such as Tang tri-colored glazed pottery, replicas of Terracotta warriors, and traditional folk handicrafts like paper-cut and shadow puppets. In addition to these cultural treasures, the market also offers modern shopping options including large shopping centers and department stores.
name: Antique Market
address: China, CN 陕西省 西安市 碑林区 长乐坊 163 163号, 邮政编码: 710033

detail_description: Xi'an Muslim Dasi Residential Quarter, also known as Huimin Street or the Muslim Quarter, is located behind the Drum Tower and around the Great Mosque. This bustling area is a popular spot for souvenir shopping, with vendors initially quoting high prices. The quarter offers a vibrant atmosphere with colorful street food catering to various budgets and tastes. As you navigate through the lively streets, you'll encounter historical insights about the arrival of Muslims in Xi'an and their connection to the Silk Road.
name: Xi'an Muslim Dasi Residential Quarter
address: 90 Beiguangji St, 钟楼商圈 Lianhu District, Xi'An, Shaanxi, China, 710008

detail_description: Xianyang Museum, located about nineteen miles northwest of Xi'an, was once the capital of the Qin Dynasty. The museum is housed in a building that was formerly a Confucian Temple and features nine exhibition halls showcasing 130,000 historical artifacts, including Buddhist statues, stone carvings, imperial tombs, and ruins dating back over 2,000 years.
name: Xianyang Museum
address: CV46+QPW, Weicheng District, Xianyang, Xianyang, Shaanxi, China, 712039

detail_description: The Muslim Street Tourist Service Station is a bustling area located just 100 meters from the Bell Tower, known for its historical significance as a stop along the Silk Road. Visitors can explore shops offering a variety of cultural specialties, including souvenirs, food, and handicrafts. The Beiyuanmen Night Market within the Muslim Quarter is a popular spot to sample local cuisine and shop for affordable goods.
name: Muslim Street Tourist Service Station
address: 167 Xiyangshi, 钟楼商圈 Lianhu District, Xi'An, Shaanxi, China, 710007
